page.title: 03GRASS.
page.content: Grass, Grass, Grass covers the land in this rural area of smallfields (5 acres). The major task in our Domesday Project work has been to convey the richness of an area which is isolated and rural with only scattered communities in a sea of grass, trees and hedgerows. The visiting picnicer sees beautiful,rolling countryside but very few dwellings. The grass ranges from intensively managed grassland, rough pasture to scrubby common land where sheep nibble between gorse and heather. Two old meadows are specially protected by conservation orders for their rare orchids and other traditional meadow flowers. Much time is spent tending the grass, silaging, haymaking and baling and the predominant colours in the landscape reflect the work and the season.
